title: According to Aristotle, how might one attain the good life? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to Aristotle the good life is the life of virtue, choosing to do what is good according to right reason. He argued that the life of virtue, not the pursuit of power, pleasure or fame is the only way to achieve happiness. He argued that the life of virtue was the fundamental foundation for happiness and all other lesser goods could then be added.

Aristotle’s book, Nichomachean Ethics (350 BC) explains the Good Life in great detail. The key term is Eudemonia, which means “flourishing.” It is different for humans than for animals — for humans it means living according to Reason — which is the uniquely human trait.

The Peloponnesian War was fought between the Greek city-states of Athens and Sparta. It lasted from 431 BC to 404 BC. Athens ended up losing the war, bringing an end to the golden age of Ancient Greece.
